title: Oktoberfest: Adelaide’s event moves to the River Torrens
text:
More than 5000 people are expected to head to Pinky Flat, on the banks of the Torrens, for Oktoberfest on Saturday afternoon.

Organiser Ross Drennan thought the change in venue would draw a larger crowd to a beautiful outdoor venue.

Inspired by the festival in Munich, the event will feature live entertainment, a silent disco, German foods pretzels and bratwurst and plenty of beer. “We’ve got about seven different imported German breweries represented at the event this year,” Mr Drennan said. Henning Klovekorn, who has been the event’s MC since 2016, said the strong-arm competition was always popular, and those wearing lederhosen and dirndls had the chance to win a best-dressed award.

“Every year there are more and more people wearing traditional dress,” he said.

Where to celebrate Oktoberfest
description: More than 5000 people are expected to head to Pinky Flat, on the banks of the Torrens, for Oktoberfest on Saturday afternoon.
